snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss could aid supporters of tighter industry regulation as they fight a last-ditch battle with the banks over new federal rules.
abstract: JPMorgan Chase’s $2 billion trading loss could aid supporters of tighter industry regulation as they fight a last-ditch battle with the banks over new federal rules.

headline.main: A Shock From JPMorgan Is New Fodder for Reformers

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
